model_input:
Your task is to choose the better response based on the below criterion.
You will be given a list of past memories, a current conversation between two individuals, and two options of next responses.

CRITERION:
Consistency - The response should not contain information that contradicts past memory and should be appropriate for the current time step.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1" or "2")

Now choose the response that has better Consistency given the past memories and current conversation.

PAST MEMORIES:
Speaker A recently gave birth to twins and is a stay-at-home mom.
Speaker A used to work at IKEA in Sweden for twelve years.
Speaker A plays tennis every week and goes to church.
Speaker A wants more children and feels lonely due to their husband's frequent traveling.
Speaker B works at a fast-food place and loves ice cream.
Speaker B is not yet in college but hopes to become an Eagle Scout.
Speaker B finds fulfillment in being a stay-at-home mom despite feeling lonely.
Speaker A is involved in church activities and mentioned a church retreat
Speaker B is a member of the boy scouts and works at a fast food place
Speaker B has not taken any vacations recently but has vacation days saved up
Speaker A suggested that Speaker B join one of the church retreats in the future.
Speaker A has twins and loves being a parent, mentioning a desire for triplets.
Speaker A is involved in a church choir and organizing a retreat, looking for volunteers.
Speaker A appreciates Speaker B's involvement with the scout troop and invites them to a youth retreat.
Speaker B is busy with scouts, school, work, and tennis, but willing to take vacation days for the retreat.
Speaker B believes in the unique connection between twins and their ability to communicate.
Speaker A has twins and is involved with their church as a volunteer.
Speaker B has been involved with Boy Scouts for 7-8 years, currently a Life Scout.
Speaker B plans to earn the Eagle Scout badge for college applications.
Speaker B is considering attending a local community college for the first couple of years.

CURRENT CONVERSATION:
Speaker A: I've heard that Boy Scouts teaches a lot of survival skills like setting up shelter and figuring out how to get a fire started no matter what materials you have on hand. Have you done any of that? I'm sure my kids would love roughing it.
Speaker B: Yes, it teaches a lot of survival skills and I would say social skills as well. You need to learn how to work together, and compromise. Yes, we often go camping and have to figure out a lot of things like how to start a fire or cook a meal with very little materials on hand. You should definitely get your kids into it.
Speaker A: Cool, thanks! Yes, that sounds wonderful, I think they would enjoy it a lot. What is your favorite part about camping?
Speaker B: I love being out in the wilderness and sleeping under the stars in the fresh air. It makes you realize how beautiful life is and how small we really are in comparison to the universe.
Speaker A: I miss doing that! I have done lots of picnics with my family but it's been a long time since I've slept in a tent! Looking forward to it again when the kids are older. Where was the last place you went?
Speaker B: We went up to an island in the middle of nowhere in Canada. There were lots of bears and huge moose!
Speaker A: Wow, that sounds like such an adventure! I love to visit Canada. I have seen moose but never a bear! That must have been scary!
Speaker B: Yes, it is quite scary. We could also hear the wolves howling at night, luckily we didn't come across them though. One thing to note about bears, is they just want to come and scrounge for our food, so we learned to safely pack it away and hang it up high in a tree.
Speaker A: Yes, I've heard that it's important to be careful in bear country! I would love to see one in person though. Do you take lots of photos on your trips?
Speaker B: Yes, I took quite a few. The scenery was stunning. Would you like me to send you some photos? I know they are uninteresting to some people.
Speaker A: Oh yes, I would love to see some photos! It will be a while before I can take a vacation myself so it's fun to see other people's adventures! 

RESPONSE 1
Speaker B: I'll send you some photos, it's always nice to share the beauty of nature with others. It might inspire you to plan your next adventure!
RESPONSE 2
Speaker B: I'll make sure to send you some photos soon. It's always nice to share the beauty of nature with others, especially when they can't get out there themselves. It's like bringing a piece of the wilderness to you.

YOUR OUTPUT:
Explanation:
prediction:
Explanation: Both responses are consistent with the past memories and the current conversation. However, Response 1 suggests that Speaker A might be inspired to plan their next adventure, which contradicts the past memory where Speaker A mentions it will be a while before they can take a vacation. Response 2 acknowledges that Speaker A may not be able to get out into the wilderness currently, which aligns with the current conversation where Speaker A mentions it will be a while before they can take a vacation.

Choice: 2
